description:
Sarah Jones, Labour shadow minister for industry and decarbonisation, accepted sponsorship for a fundraising event from a public affairs company that represents BP and British Gas, DeSmog can reveal.  Jones’s register of interests shows that she received food and drink worth £2,500 on 10 May from Beyond 2050, a pro-hydrogen PR firm that represents some […]

The post Labour’s Shadow Decarbonisation Minister Received Sponsorship from Gas Industry Lobbyists appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Labour’s Shadow Decarbonisation Minister Received Sponsorship from Gas Industry Lobbyists

description:
This article by Grist is published here as part of the global journalism collaboration Covering Climate Now. Since the 1980s, the 85-mile stretch of the Mississippi River that connects New Orleans and Baton Rouge, Louisiana, has been known as “Cancer Alley.” The name stems from the fact that the area’s residents have a 95 percent greater chance […]

The post Real-Time Data Show the Air in Louisiana’s ‘Cancer Alley’ is Even Worse Than Expected appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Real-Time Data Show the Air in Louisiana’s ‘Cancer Alley’ is Even Worse Than Expected
